security: This document contains information regarding Richard Gibson, also known as "Sugar," and his connections to various organizations, including the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPCC), and individuals with ties to communist activities. Disclosure of Gibson's role as a CIA operative and the Agency's operational interest in him could compromise ongoing intelligence activities. Further, revelation of sources such as CG 7262-S could lead to their identification and endangerment. As stated in the document, unauthorized disclosure could compromise CG 7262-S as well as a CIA source and thus cause severe damage to defense interests.
summary: This document is a collection of memos, summaries, and reports regarding Richard Thomas Gibson, also known as "Sugar," his activities, and his connections with various organizations, including the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPCC). It details his involvement with communist activities, his travels, and his contacts, as well as the FBI and CIA's interest in him.
summary_one_paragraph: This compilation of documents, including an identification form and several memos and summaries, focuses on Richard Thomas Gibson, cryptonym "Sugar," and his multifaceted activities from 1960 to 1972. Gibson, a former Acting Executive Secretary of the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPCC) and a journalist, is described as having connections to communist entities and involvement in various organizations across the United States, Europe, and Africa. The documents detail FBI and CIA surveillance of Gibson, noting his travels, associations, and role as a CIA source. The collection includes information from confidential sources, congressional testimonies, and reports from international agencies, providing a comprehensive overview of Gibson's activities and the intelligence community's interest in him.
